replies.text:
@ronaldtoran4332 we found brainwashed victim of USA's propaganda lol

Genociding the Uyghurs??
What evidence??

First, they accused China doing genocide.
Since they couldn't prove it (as was the case with Iraq's weapons of mass destruction), the narrative was turned into re-education.

But because the USA has also done the same thing which is even worse (Guantanamo Bay detention CAMP), the narrative was turned into cultural genocide and now slave labor.

Do you see the theme in this!!!

Yes, 22 "Western" countries and Japan criticizing Xinjiang "camps".
But 54 countries, most of them are "Muslim-majority" states, defended China's counter-extremism efforts in Xinjiang.

The majority of Muslim countries in Arabia do not believe in western propaganda and support China regarding the Uyghurs case!!!
You should know that the bond of brotherhood between fellow Muslims is very strong.

Why is that?

Because the Organization for Islamic Cooperation (OIC) which has 57 Muslim-majority countries as members, sent a strong delegation to Xinjiang to investigate various accusations about Xinjiang in 2019. 

Without exception, all Muslim countries around the world either support or have no objection to China's Xinjiang policies.
All Muslim countries even praising China's counter-terrorism and deradicalization measures in Xinjiang.

Those Muslim countries in Arabia come to China to see the situation directly so they know it is just USA and West propaganda, while western countries denied the invitation but keep with their dirty propaganda.

In May of 2023, Thomas Heberer, a senior professor at the university of Duisburg-Essen, and Helwig Schmidt-Glintzer, a professor at the University of G√∂ttingen and Director of China Centrum T√ºbingen in German, travelled together with 2 other German shcolars and an international lawyer to Xinjiang to conducted their own private investigation.
Their article was later published in a Swiss newspaper which concluded what was happening in Xinjiang was the result of "massive Islamist terror between 2010 and 2016" with "12 separatist-Islamist movement" active at the same time.
The article also said that it should not be overlooked that the Uyghurs population itself suffered from the terror and Beijing was forced to declare a 'state of emergency'.
And finally, the group was UNABLE to detect ANY general discrimation against the Uyghurs language and culture!!!

As you can see from these incidents clearly there was a terrorism issue in Xinjiang, and something needed to be done by the Chinese authorities before the situation got out of control.

When terrorist attacks happened in Xinjiang, China had two choices:
1. Re-educate the Uighur extremists before they turned terrorists.
2. Let them be to carry on their terrorists, then launch attacks, bomb their homes and kill innocent people.
China chose the first, while the USA chose the second.
You should know which option is better!!!

China chose 1 to solve the problem from the root without committing murder. 
How do the US and the West solve terrorism? 
Fire missiles from battleships, drop bombs from the sky.

How USA and Western anti-terrorism?
Invade their countries, kill the leaders and soldiers together with civilians, destroy their cities, towns, and villages.
Done!  
Western Media: Heros!

How China anti-terrorism?
Re-educate extremists, teach laws and skills so that they can work and reduce poverty.
Done!  
Western Media: Genocide!

replies.author: @FAFORednickincell
replies.text:
@ronaldtoran4332 

I dare you to go to Xinjiang and find out the truth 

Instead of parroting western Mainstream Media 

a guy like you does not believe a single word they tell you‚Ä¶ unless it‚Äôs about China üôÑüôÑüôÑ

When some Muslim Uyghur Chinese committed terrorist acts on Chinese streets 

Where some Uyghur Chinese were thrown into re-education camps, and some mosques housing extremist were removed 

The world called it cultural genocide 

Where some Palestinians escaped their Gaza Ghettos committed terrorist acts on Israeli streets. 

 We in the world call that terrorism, justifying the bombing of Palestinian civilians in their Gaza Ghettos

Which begs the question China throws money at their ethnic Uyghur Chinese minority and gives them special rights over the Han majority. 

(Like the ability to have more than 1 kid when the rule was still enforced back then. Preferential treatment for minorities when it comes to University Education etc) 

 like they do with all their ethnic minority people they consider as Chinese 

 What does Israel consider these Palestinian people as??? 

As they bomb  them in those Gaza Ghettoes Israel forced them into. 

Yet in this situation, we mostly stay silent on that genocide 

üëá

Imperialist media can‚Äôt stop lying about mosques in China


* Firsthand report from Kashgar

On a recent visit to Kashgar, Xinjiang, home to about 80% of the ethnic Uygur population, this writer had a chance to speak to residents and learn about local architecture. Many of the buildings in Kashgar are 1,000 or more years old. These old buildings, while stunningly beautiful, were not built to standards that would be considered seismically safe today in areas with a risk of earthquakes. In the past, collapses and deaths were common.

* In 2020, the U.S. Mosque Survey counted 2,769 mosques in this country, compared to China‚Äôs more than 35,000 mosques. This means that Chinese Muslims have nearly three times more mosques per capita than do Muslims in the U.S.


But the accusations don‚Äôt stop at alleged demolition. The Western media have also claimed that the Chinese government is carrying out a process of ‚ÄúSinification‚Äù through the renovations, meaning that China is allegedly removing the Arabic aspects of mosques and replacing them with traditional Chinese architecture.

Mosques built in the traditional Chinese-style architecture are presented in the Western media as ‚Äúevidence‚Äù of ‚Äúcultural erasure,‚Äù when in reality mosques built in Chinese style have existed as far back as around 700 C.E. There are also many Muslim populations in China that are not Arabic in origin, such as the Hui population, who were originally descended from Han Chinese and are Chinese-speaking.

Because of the ancient Silk Road and the historical mixing of peoples from the Chinese coast with Arab, European and many other peoples, the blending of language, religion and architecture should not be seen as an attempt at Han hegemony, but rather as a natural blending of peoples living side-by-side in a multiethnic nation with more than 5,000 years of recorded history.

WorkersWorld

author: @echowhiskey1368
text:
But bear in mind that drinking beer in public in daytime is still looking odd, but no one cares unless you make trouble. I think it is because people who noticed you would think: is this guy out of job or an alcoholic? If you do make trouble, people would watch you playing your game and maybe post it on social media for some clicks, some other may call the cops. 

When police show up, they may ask you to sit down to calm down to get sober a little bit, hand you a bottle of water, then ask you to contact your friends or family to get you home, if you are too wasted to do so, they would get you back to station and somehow get your friend or family to collect you. If you have hit someone or damaged some property, that would be at least overnight at a station for investigation.

author: @RedScareClair
text: To be fair, the genetic inability to process alcohol is pretty prevalent in East Asia - between 20-30% - possibly more. That and there's a big self control culture that I don't think quite exists in the West. So I think Eddie's assumption that they probably have less idiots is correct. Don't get me wrong, I have a friend that lives in Taiwan that's at bars fairly frequently on weekends, I've had Chinese friends that could drink with the best of them, and I've had my share of Sake and Kirin, but it wouldn't be surprising if East Asian drinking culture vs British/American drinking culture were extremely different. Then of course there's the European religious influence that wanted to ban everything that isn't as prevalent there.

‚Äã@AndrewsMobs LOL. Thanks for admitting it's state capitalism! Yes, socialism was big on capitalism!

Marx adored capitalism. Where did he write about that again? Was it in his Manifesto? Das Kapital? His critique of Hegel's Philosophy of Right? His writings on the Paris Commune? Tell me about how socialism work for any of the disappeared Chinese Ministers, or perhaps former President Hu Jintao, or the Ink Girl, or anyone Xi views as a political rival and who is now imprisoned or permanently missing?  Xi made the poor Ink Girl disappear 4 years ago into a mental asylum and nobody has seen her since. All she did was deface a picture of him in public. That's not socialism. That's hell, objectively speaking. I guess I'm the type of socialist who believes Marxist socialism, ie strictly bottom-up democratic socialism, not state capitalism. not authoritarianism, not fascism, not nationalism and not brutal police states.
